alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Kearney (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 11 at 12:09AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...STRONG WINDS POSSIBLE FROM HEAT BURST OVER BUFFALO AND KEARNEY COUNTIES... At around midnight, strong wind gusts of up to 56 MPH occurred near Kearney in Buffalo County. This rare weather phenomenon called a heat burst will remain possible over Buffalo and Kearney Counties through 215 AM. Heat bursts are caused by decaying thunderstorms and only develop in an extremely unique environment. The rare setup for a heat burst is dry air directly beneath a weakening elevated thunderstorm. When a thunderstorm is weakening, air within the thunderstorms begins to sink. If this sinking air is very dry and high enough, it will begin to accelerate toward the ground since it is more dense. Any remaining precipitation will fall through this dry air and quickly evaporate. As the air continues downward, it warms rapidly due to compression.
